intro: Scorzonera inconspicua, commonly known as the inconspicuous scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Its leaves are usually basal, oblanceolate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Scorzonera inconspicua is often found in open habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
